00004  *    C++ example using dtracklib without DTrack remote control

00020  *
00021  *
00022  * Purpose:
00023  *  - example without DTrack remote commands: collects DTrack data
00024  *  - using DTrackSDK v2.0.2
00025  *  - tested under Linux (gcc) and MS Windows 2000/XP (MS Visual C++)
00026  *

00029 #include "DTracklib.hpp"
00030 
00031 #include <iostream>
00032 #include <sstream>
00033 #include <stdlib.h>
00034 #include <stdio.h>
00035 
00036 using namespace std;
00037 
00038 // global DTracklib
00039 static DTracklib* dt = NULL;
00040 
00041 
00045 static void output_to_console()
00046 {
00047         printf("\nframe %lu ts %.3f nbodcal %d nbod %d nfly %d nmea %d nmar %d ngl %d\n",
00048                 dt->get_framenr(), dt->get_timestamp(), dt->get_nbodycal(), dt->get_nbody(),
00049                 dt->get_nflystick(), dt->get_nmeatool(), dt->get_nmarker(), dt->get_nglove());
00050 
00051         // bodies:
00052         dtracklib_body_type body;
00053         for(int i=0; i<dt->get_nbody(); i++){
00054                 body = dt->get_body(i);
00055 
00056                 printf("bod %lu qu %.3f loc %.2f %.2f %.2f ang %.2f %.2f %.2f rot %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f\n",
00057                         body.id, body.quality,
00058                         body.loc[0], body.loc[1], body.loc[2],
00059                         body.ang[0], body.ang[1], body.ang[2],
00060                         body.rot[0], body.rot[1], body.rot[2], body.rot[3], body.rot[4], body.rot[5],
00061                         body.rot[6], body.rot[7], body.rot[8]);
00062         }
00063 
00064         // A.R.T. FlySticks:
00065         dtracklib_flystick_type flystick;
00066         for(int i=0; i<dt->get_nflystick(); i++){
00067                 flystick = dt->get_flystick(i);
00068                 
00069                 printf("fly %lu qu %.3f bt %lx loc %.2f %.2f %.2f ang %.2f %.2f %.2f rot %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f\n",
00070                         flystick.id, flystick.quality, flystick.bt,
00071                         flystick.loc[0], flystick.loc[1], flystick.loc[2],
00072                         flystick.ang[0], flystick.ang[1], flystick.ang[2],
00073                         flystick.rot[0], flystick.rot[1], flystick.rot[2], flystick.rot[3], flystick.rot[4], flystick.rot[5],
00074                         flystick.rot[6], flystick.rot[7], flystick.rot[8]);
00075         }
00076 
00077         // measurement tools:
00078         dtracklib_meatool_type meatool;
00079         for(int i=0; i<dt->get_nmeatool(); i++){
00080                 meatool = dt->get_meatool(i);
00081                 
00082                 printf("mea %lu qu %.3f bt %lx loc %.2f %.2f %.2f rot %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f\n",
00083                         meatool.id, meatool.quality, meatool.bt,
00084                         meatool.loc[0], meatool.loc[1], meatool.loc[2],
00085                         meatool.rot[0], meatool.rot[1], meatool.rot[2], meatool.rot[3], meatool.rot[4], meatool.rot[5],
00086                         meatool.rot[6], meatool.rot[7], meatool.rot[8]);
00087         }
00088 
00089         // markers:
00090         dtracklib_marker_type marker;
00091         for(int i=0; i<dt->get_nmarker(); i++){
00092                 marker = dt->get_marker(i);
00093                 
00094                 printf("mar %d qu %.3f loc %.2f %.2f %.2f\n",
00095                         marker.id, marker.quality,
00096                         marker.loc[0], marker.loc[1], marker.loc[2]);
00097         }
00098 
00099         // A.R.T. Fingertracking hands:
00100         dtracklib_glove_type glove;
00101         for(int i=0; i<dt->get_nglove(); i++){
00102                 glove = dt->get_glove(i);
00103                 
00104                 printf("gl %d qu %.3f lr %s nf %d loc %.2f %.2f %.2f rot %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f\n",
00105                         glove.id, glove.quality, (glove.lr == 0) ? "left" : "right", glove.nfinger,
00106                         glove.loc[0], glove.loc[1], glove.loc[2],
00107                         glove.rot[0], glove.rot[1], glove.rot[2], glove.rot[3], glove.rot[4], glove.rot[5],
00108                         glove.rot[6], glove.rot[7], glove.rot[8]);
00109                 
00110                 for(int j=0; j<glove.nfinger; j++){
00111                         printf("  fi %d loc %.1f %.1f %.1f rot %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f\n",
00112                                 j, glove.finger[j].loc[0], glove.finger[j].loc[1], glove.finger[j].loc[2],
00113                                 glove.finger[j].rot[0], glove.finger[j].rot[1], glove.finger[j].rot[2],
00114                                 glove.finger[j].rot[3], glove.finger[j].rot[4], glove.finger[j].rot[5],
00115                                 glove.finger[j].rot[6], glove.finger[j].rot[7], glove.finger[j].rot[8]);
00116                         printf("  fi %d tip %.1f pha %.1f %.1f %.1f ang %.1f %.1f\n",
00117                                 j, glove.finger[j].radiustip,
00118                                 glove.finger[j].lengthphalanx[0], glove.finger[j].lengthphalanx[1], glove.finger[j].lengthphalanx[2],
00119                                 glove.finger[j].anglephalanx[0], glove.finger[j].anglephalanx[1]);
00120                 }
00121         }
00122 }
00123 
00124 
00130 static bool error_to_console()
00131 {
00132         if(dt->timeout()){
00133                 cout << "--- timeout while waiting for udp data" << endl;
00134                 return false;
00135         }
00136 
00137         if(dt->udperror()){
00138                 cout << "--- error while receiving udp data" << endl;
00139                 return false;
00140         }
00141 
00142         if(dt->parseerror()){
00143                 cout << "--- error while parsing udp data" << endl;
00144                 return false;
00145         }
00146 
00147         return true;
00148 }
00149 
00150 
00154 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00155 {
00156         if(argc != 2){
00157                 cout << "Usage: " << argv[0] << " <data port>" << endl;
00158                 return -1;
00159         }
00160 
00161         istringstream portstream(argv[1]);
00162         int port;
00163         portstream >> port;  // data port
00164 
00165 
00166         if(portstream.fail() || port <=0 || port >= 65536){
00167                 cout << "invalid port '" << argv[1] << "'" << endl;
00168                 return -2;
00169         }
00170 
00171         // init library:
00172         dt = new DTracklib(port);
00173 
00174         if(!dt->valid()){
00175                 cout << "dtracklib init error" << endl;
00176                 return -3;
00177         }
00178 
00179         // receiving:
00180         int loop_count = 0;
00181         while(loop_count++ < 100){
00182 
00183                 if(dt->receive()){
00184                         output_to_console();
00185                 } else {
00186                         error_to_console();
00187                 }
00188 
00189         }
00190 
00191         // clean up:
00192         delete dt;
00193 
00194         return 0;
00195 }
